titleInfo.title: Alvarado v. Ramineni et al
titleInfo.subTitle: REPORT-RECOMMENDATION: RECOMMENDED that Defendants' motion to dismiss for failure to state a claim (Dkt. No. [10-2]) be GRANTED in part and DENIED in part. It is recommended that Plaintiff's ADA and Rehabilitation Act claims against DOCS be dismissed without prejudice to Plaintiff amending his claim regarding the failure to transfer him to a flat facility and that Defendants Ramineni and DOCS be directed to answer Plaintiff's Eighth Amendment claim. Objections to R&R due by 3/29/2010 Case Review Deadline 4/5/2010. Signed by Magistrate Judge George H. Lowe on 3/15/10. (report-recommendation served on plaintiff by regular mail)(mnc)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 9:08-cv-01126; Alvarado v. Ramineni et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Northern District of New York
extension.docketText: REPORT-RECOMMENDATION: RECOMMENDED that Defendants' motion to dismiss for failure to state a claim (Dkt. No. [10-2]) be GRANTED in part and DENIED in part. It is recommended that Plaintiff's ADA and Rehabilitation Act claims against DOCS be dismissed without prejudice to Plaintiff amending his claim regarding the failure to transfer him to a flat facility and that Defendants Ramineni and DOCS be directed to answer Plaintiff's Eighth Amendment claim. Objections to R&R due by 3/29/2010 Case Review Deadline 4/5/2010. Signed by Magistrate Judge George H. Lowe on 3/15/10. (report-recommendation served on plaintiff by regular mail)(mnc)

titleInfo.title: Alvarado v. Ramineni et al
titleInfo.subTitle: DECISION AND ORDER adopting Magistrate Judge Lowe's 17 Report and Recommendations in its entirety; granting in part Defts' 10 Motion to Dismiss; Plaintiff's claim against DOCS is dismissed as to the ADA and Rehabilitation Act without prejudice to Pltf to amend his claim. Signed by Senior Judge Thomas J. McAvoy on 7/22/2010. (amt) [Pltf served via reg. mail]

titleInfo.title: Alvarado v. Ramineni et al
titleInfo.subTitle: REPORT - RECOMMENDATION AND ORDER: RECOMMENDED that Defendants' motion for summary judgment (Dkt. No. 31) be GRANTED; and it is further ORDERED that the Clerk provide Plaintiff with a copy of Chavis v. Goord, No. 07- 4787-pr, 2009 U.S. App. LEXIS 13681, 2009 WL 1803454 (2d Cir. June 25, 2009); Murray v. Ramineni, No. 08-CV-809, 2011 U.S. Dist. LEXIS 35734, 2011 WL 1315777 (N.D.N.Y. Mar. 3, 2011); and Nelson v. Rodas, No. 01-CV-7887, 2002 U.S. Dist. LEXIS 17359, 2002 WL 31075804 (S.D.N.Y. Sept. 17, 2002). Objections to R&R due by 12/20/2011. Case Review Deadline 12/27/2011. Signed by Magistrate Judge George H. Lowe on 12/6/2011. (Attachments: # (1) Nelson Caselaw, # (2) Chavis Caselaw, # (3) Murray Caselaw) (ptm) (copy served on plaintiff with attachements by regular mail)

titleInfo.title: Alvarado v. Ramineni et al
titleInfo.subTitle: DECISION AND ORDER adopting Magistrate Judge Lowe's 37 Report and Recommendations; granting Defendant's 31 Motion for Summary Judgment and dismissing the Complaint. Signed by Senior Judge Thomas J. McAvoy on 1/3/2012. (amt) [Pltf served via reg. and cert. mail]
